quizzes.title: Geography Quiz: Mascot and Bill
quizzes.description: Test your geography knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Geography, actor, woodsy. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: What should you do if you think you are in possession of a counterfeit bill?

options.text: Find a suitable printer and make more
Attempt to return it to the passer
Contact your local police department or United States Secret Service field office

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Contact your local police department or United States Secret Service field office

questions.question: The 9 Lives cat food mascot is named Norris.
This actor began voicing the Aflac duck in 1999.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Gilbert Gottfried

questions.question: From 1970-1990, Bounty paper towels employed Nancy Walker as this mascot.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Rosie the waitress

questions.question: Which of the following cities does not have a Federal Reserve Bank?
What was the name of the mascot used by Good n Plenty Candy in the 1950s?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Choo Choo Charlie

questions.question: Woodsy Owl is the first mascot used by The U.S. Forest Service.
What is the name of the Jolly Green Giants little friend?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Little Sprout

questions.question: Which state name means the object towards which the action of the sea is directed?
Whose portrait appears on the face of the $20 bill?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Andrew Jackson

questions.question: What is the name of MTM Productions mascot?
Kelsey Grammer has voiced the GEICO gecko.
When did Planters Peanuts begin using Mr. Peanut as its mascot?
The inscription,  E Pluribus Unum, appears in the left hand seal, above the pyramid, on the $1 bill.
This mascot, played by David Leisure, was used by Isuzu during 1986-1990?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Joe Isuzu

quizzes.title: Geography Quiz: State and Verse
quizzes.description: Test your geography knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Geography, origin, world. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: The Dutch played an important role in colonizing the East Coast of the United States. But only one state name is derived from Dutch. Which one?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Rhode Island

questions.question: Which state was named in honor of a non-English royalty?
Which state name doesnt refer to a king or a queen?
What is the meaning of Indiana?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Land of the Indians

questions.question: Which state name means great river?
Fill in the missing words:

options.text: dry leaves that before the wild hurricane fly,

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Saint Nicholas, too.

questions.question: What is the missing word?

options.text: d then, in a twinkling, I heard on the roof
I drew in my hand, and was turning around,
wn the _______ St. Nicholas came with a bound!

questions.question: What does Dakota mean?
What does Nevada mean?
Find the missing words:

options.text: d his clothes were all tarnished with ashes and soot;
bundle of toys he had flung on his back,
d he looked like a peddler ____ _______ ___ ____.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: just opening his pack.

questions.question: The name of which US state means beautiful?
Which state name is not color-related?
Complete the verse:
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: a cherry

questions.question: What is the origin of the name Delaware?

options.text: It comes from the Spanish phrase de lavaros (roughly: of the misers)
It means shore of whales in Algonquian.
This is the name of the Native American tribe that used to live there.
The state was named after Lord de la Warr who traveled the Delaware River in 1610.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The state was named after Lord de la Warr who traveled the Delaware River in 1610.

questions.question: Which language is the source of most US states names?

quizzes.title: History Quiz: Halloween and Jack
quizzes.description: Test your history knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering History, people, line. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: The very first organized Halloween celebration in the U.S. was in Ohio.
Halloween was originally the celebration of the New Year.
Traditionally, jack-o-lanterns were lit with oil to keep them lit for long periods of time.
The traditional Jack-O-Lantern got its name from a man named Jack.
Complete the line from the famous Christmas poem:

options.text: d the beard of his chin was __ _____ __ ___ ____;
d the smoke it encircled his head like a wreath;

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: as white as the snow

questions.question: Trick-or-Treating is a strictly modern custom on Halloween.
What are the missing words?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: a bowlful of jelly

questions.question: The Irish originally used turnips to make Jack-o-Lanterns on Halloween.
In How the Grinch Stole Christmas, what biological shortcoming made the Grinch so mean?

options.text: He was diagnosed as being schizophrenic.
He was diagnosed as being bipolar.
His heart was two sizes smaller than normal.
His brain was two sizes smaller than normal.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: His heart was two sizes smaller than normal.

questions.question: In the Irish tradition people did not bob for apples on Halloween, but potatoes instead.
Choose the correct words to complete the verse:

options.text: d away they all flew like the down of a thistle.
t I heard him exclaim, ere he drove out of sight,
hope I didnt give you a fright !!
may you sleep nice and tight !!
and to all a good night !!
hope your clothes fit just right !!

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: and to all a good night !!

questions.question: The tradition of trick-or-treating for UNICEF began in Philadelphia in 1950.
What word is missing?

options.text: d laying his finger aside of his _____,
d giving a nod, up the chimney he rose;

questions.question: Halloween was banned during World War II.
Halloween is the 3rd most commercially successful holiday right after Valentines Day.

quizzes.title: Geography Quiz: Christmas and Issue
quizzes.description: Test your geography knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Geography, magazine, issue. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: In A Charlie Brown Christmas, what winter recreation is the cast of characters doing in the opening scene?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Ice skating

questions.question: The first issue of Playboy magazine, printed in 53,991copies, had what date on its cover?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: None of these

questions.question: In the movie The Santa Clause, why does Scott Calvin (played by Tim Allen) become Santa Clause?

options.text: Santa died by falling off the roof leaving behind instructions for Scott.
Santa broke his leg by falling off the roof and he needed Scott to be his replacement.
Scotts son wanted him to do so.
Scott took a job at a department store as Santa and liked it.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Santa died by falling off the roof leaving behind instructions for Scott.

questions.question: What was the name that Hugh Hefner initially intended to give to Playboy magazine?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Stag Party

questions.question: If you received all of the gifts in the Twelve Days of Christmas, how many would you receive all together?

2005 featured one of the most moving Super Bowl commercials ever aired. The only sound heard is the background noise of an airport terminal until you hear one person starting to clap their hands. Others start to clap until the entire waiting room is filled with the sounds of clapping hands. Who was passing by the crowd in this scene of the Super Bowl commercial?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Desert Storm Soldiers

questions.question: Where is the United States’ official national Christmas tree located?

options.text: Kings Canyon National Park in California
Big Bend National Park in Texas

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Kings Canyon National Park in California

questions.question: American Civil War nurse Clara Barton was born on Christmas day in what year?
When did Hallmark introduce their first Christmas cards?
How many times is the name of Santa Claus used in The Night Before Christmas?
Was the Miracle on 34th Street filmed in New York?
When did Playboy photographers take the photo of Marilyn Monroe, which became the first centerfold?
According to The Twelve Days of Christmas, how many pipers piping did my true love give to me?
In South Africa, what season does Christmas occur in?
What was the first U.S. state to recognize Christmas as an official holiday?

quizzes.title: Geography Quiz: Barbados and Playboy
quizzes.description: Test your geography knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Geography, independence, magazine. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: The volcano in the center of Barbados is called Mount Hillaby.
Although the majority of the inhabitants speak a patois, or dialect, this is the official language of Barbados.

This company launched a series of ads to combat its competitor. They show a young guy dressed in jeans and tee shirt on the right and an overweight dork, wearing a suit and glasses on the left. The guy in jeans was used as the image for what product?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Apples Mac

questions.question: Most of the inhabitants of Barbados originate from where?
Leonardo Da Vinci’s perhaps most famous fresco, The Last Supper, is found in the refectory of Santa Maria delle Grazie in what Italian city?
Who was the first person interviewed for the “Playboy Interview, a monthly column famous for its confrontational style.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Miles Davis

questions.question: This famous politician said the following words in a Playboy interview: Ive looked on a lot of women with lust. Ive committed adultery in my heart many times.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Jimmy Carter

questions.question: What was Barbados named for?

options.text: The barbed sea shells that littered the beaches.
The many bearded fig trees on the island.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The many bearded fig trees on the island.

questions.question: The reputation of which league was hurt by Michael Vick?
From which country did Barbados gain its independence in 1966?
In December 1998, this figure skater, winner of two Olympic gold medals appeared on the cover of Playboy magazine.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Katarina Witt

questions.question: What it the area of Barbados?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: 166 sq miles

questions.question: What designer created the famous Playboy logo, depicting a rabbit with a tuxedo bow tie?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Art Paul

questions.question: This person, who in 1979 established the Hugh M. Hefner First Amendment Award, became CEO of Playboy in 1988.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Christine Hefner

questions.question: This issue of Playboy magazine sold 7,161,561 copies. A cropped image of the issues centerfold, featuring Swedish model Lena Soderberg, became a standard image for testing image processing algorithms.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: November, 1972 issue

quizzes.title: Geography Quiz: City and Capital
quizzes.description: Test your geography knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Geography, auguste, sculpture. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: Winnipeg is the capital of which Canadian province?
The Van Gogh Museum is found in what city?
Napoleon Bonaparte I is entombed in Les Invalides, a former military hospital found in what European city/town?
Which city is the capital of the province of Quebec?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Quebec City

questions.question: What is the capital of Newfoundland and Labrador, the oldest European settlement in North America?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: St. Johns

questions.question: This capital of New Scotland was almost destroyed on December 6, 1917 when 2 ships collided in its harbor.
Brussels’ famous comedic statue, Manneken Pis, has a female counterpart. Where will you find the Jeanneke Pis?
One of the two of Michelangelos greatest works of sculpture, David, can be found in what European city?
One of the two of Michelangelos greatest works of sculpture, the Pietà, is found in what European city?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The Vatican

questions.question: A museum dedicated to French sculptor Auguste Rodin is found in Philadelphia, USA and what European city?
This west coast provincial capital is named after British Royalty.
One of the world’s most famous opera houses, “Teatro alla Scala” (or La Scala), is located in what city?
In what European city is the Rembrandt House Museum located?
This Canadian city of Stately Elms is located on the banks of the St. John River and was established as provincial capital on April 25, 1785.
Which of these towns in the Netherlands regularly hold cheese markets in their town squares?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: All of these
